data:
Facsimile Images

Γυμνασιάρχης
Εὐβουλίδας
Ἡρακλείου

Apparatus criticus

Text after Orsi 1900, but corrected; Cordiano notes the oddity of line 1 and speculates that we should read Γυμνασιαρχήσ[ας]
line.2: Orsi: ΕΥΚΟΥΛΙΔΑΣ

English translation

Gymnasiarch Euboulidas, son of Herakleios

commentary

The origin of the stone is uncertain, found together with ISic002946, according to Orsi, in the garden of the former convent of the Cappuchins, in the late C19 AD; however both are apparently reported in earlier antiquarian texts (see Soraci 1958, and Manganaro 1963), and Manganaro speculates that both perhaps come originally from nearby Civita, thought possibly to be the site of ancient Aetna-Inessa.

bibliography

    Orsi 1900 55 no.28 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001707 Soraci 1958 253 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001571 Manganaro 1963 57 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001850 Cordiano 1997 38-39 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002064
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
